page.title: 12A66 Trunk Road
page.content: The A66 is a major road that runs between Teesside and Workington{(East {to West Coast). The section of the road going through this block area was originally a Roman road and so tends to be very straight. Major alterations began in{March 1981 and were completed in{June 1983.}These alterations involved flattening hills and creating a new dual carriageway. Some local quarries were re-opened for stone and ballast.Farm houses and buildings on the new route had to be demolished and rebuilt nearby. The road improvements mean that the heavy traffic now moves more easily and safely with much less congestion on Galley Hill. Many wayside buildings were once coaching inns.Gallows Inn was the most famous,for highwaymen were hanged on Gallows Hill (now called Galley Hill).
